question: A 44-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient clinic with a progressive loss of temporal field of vision. Visual field testing confirms bitemporal hemianopia. When compressed, which of the following structures is most likely to result in this defect?
The hyoid bone develops from which of the following embryological structures?

Histological features of an organ demonstrated mucosa lined by stratified squamous nonkeratinized epithelium with papillae. The core of the organ is of skeletal muscles. Which of the following organ matches this description?
Conductive deafness is caused by what?

answers.option: Impaired sound transmission through the auditory canal

question: Which of the following is the most common benign tumor of parotid gland?
Von Ebner's gland is what type of gland?
Which of the following cells mainly causes lateral inhibition?
The olfactory epithelium is located at which site in the nasal cavity?

answers.option: It is not present in the nasal cavity
Anterior and lateral portion of nasal cavity
Inferior portion of the nasal cavity
Posterior and lateral portion of nasal cavity

question: A patient presents with a lesion of an optic tract. As a result, he is unable to see on the opposite side of the head from both eyes. This condition is called?
What are the stereocilia of the hair cells of the organ of Corti are embedded in?
Which fibers are responsible for the retraction of the mandible?
Myopia is corrected by what type of lens?
The greatest difference of refractive indices is found at which of the following sites?

answers.option: Between aqueous humor and the anterior surface of lens
Between posterior surface of cornea and aqueous humor
Between air and anterior surface of cornea
Between the posterior surface of lens and vitreous humor

question: Which of the following gives rise to the pigment epithelium layer of an eye?
At what level is the isthmus of the thyroid gland present?

answers.option: Oblique line of the thyroid cartilage till the 6th tracheal ring

question: A patient developed winging of the scapula after deep cervical lymph node biopsy. Which nerve is involved?
Which nucleus receives fibers from the optic tract to cause pupillary constriction?
What is the afferent part of the gag reflex?
A unilateral cleft lip is formed by the non-union of which two structures?

answers.option: Medial nasal prominence and mandibular prominence
Medial nasal prominence and lateral nasal prominence
Maxillary prominence and medial nasal prominence
Lateral nasal prominence and maxillary prominence
Medial nasal prominence and frontal prominence

question: The nose is connected to the nasopharynx and divided by a septum. What is the nasal septum made up of?

answers.option: Septal cartilage, vomer, and ethmoid bone
Septal cartilage, zygomatic bone, and maxillary bone

question: What type of eye movements are responsible for viewing rapidly changing scenes, jumping from one scene to the next in a few seconds?
Which two muscles attach to the oblique line of the thyroid cartilage:
Which cartilage is the thyroid cartilage made of?
What relaxer of the vocal cords attaches to the thyroid cartilage?

A 25-year-old male with a history of recurrent middle ear infections presents to the outpatient department with complaints of hearing loss and a sense of fullness in his right ear. On examination, a bulging tympanic membrane was observed. Audiometry confirms conducting hearing loss in the affected ear. Which of the following structures is most likely involved?
The pterygomaxillary fissure connects the pterygopalatine fossa with the infratemporal fossa. Which of the following blood vessels pass through the fissure?
During a dental procedure, anesthesia was given by a nerve block passing through the incisive foramen. Which of the following nerves was blocked for anesthesia?

During the anatomy demonstration class, the anatomist showed a model of the largest paranasal sinus to students which opens into the nose. Which of the following is the site of the opening of the concerned sinus?

During tonsillectomy, the surgeon is cautious while doing surgery to avoid injury to a nerve that accompanies the tonsillar artery on the lateral wall of the pharynx. Which of the following nerves is vulnerable?
A student wants to study the gross anatomical features of the atypical cervical vertebrae. Which of the following features will help the student to identify these atypical vertebrae?

answers.option: Axis has a ring like structure
The atlas lacks a vertebral body and a spinous process
The C7 is having anterior tubercle on its anterior arch
Odontoid process or dens is present on the atlas
Axis has a long spinous process

question: In the case of trauma to the largest salivary gland of serous type, which of the following nerves are most likely to be damaged?

A patient visited the outpatient department complaining of difficulty opening the mouth for a few days. Examination and investigation led to the diagnosis of infection of the muscle of mastication in the infratemporal fossa responsible for opening the mouth when it contracts. Which of the following is the appropriate muscle?

During the demonstration of norma lateralis of the skull, students were discussing the thinnest part of the lateral wall of the skull where the anteroinferior corner of the parietal bone articulates with the greater wing of the sphenoid. Which of the following is the name of this part?

The medial end of the petrous part of the temporal bone is irregular, and together with the basilar part of the occipital bone and the greater wing of the sphenoid forms which of the following foramina?
The nasopalatine nerve arises from the maxillary nerve. Through which of the following openings does this nerve enter the nasal cavity from the pterygopalatine fossa?
Which of the following is the appropriate vein draining the venous plexus located in the infratemporal fossa?

The pterygopalatine fossa is a major site of distribution for the maxillary nerve (V2) and for the terminal part of the maxillary artery because of its strategic location. The fossa communicates with the middle cranial fossa through which of the following foramina?
Which of the following histological features best describes the tarsal plate in the eyelid?

answers.option: Loose connective tissue layer with sebaceous glands
Loose connective tissue layer with sebaceous glands
Dense connective tissue layer with Meibomian glands.
Dense connective tissue layer with gland of molls
Dense connective tissue layer with gland of Zeis

question: On examination of the oral cavity, the patient elicits a gag reflex. Which of the following nerves forms the afferent component of the reflex?

A middle-aged man visits an ENT specialist, complaining of nasal blockade and headache. Examination shows a swollen mucous membrane of the superior nasal meatus. Which of the following paranasal sinuses is most likely blocked?
During a tutorial class topic of eyelid histology was discussed. Which of the following best describes the glands of Zeis?

Submandibular salivary glands are of mixed variety. The secretory portion contains both serous and mucous acini, continuing into intercalated ducts. These ducts are lined by which of the following epithelium?
The lens in the eye consists of primary and secondary lens fibers. Secondary lens fibers continue to form till which of the following?

Coloboma of iris is characterized by a localized gap in the iris or a notch in the pupillary margin, giving the pupil a keyhole appearance. Coloboma of the iris results from defective closure of which of the following structures?
Several paranasal sinuses open in the middle meatus. Which of the following has an opening in the hiatus semilunaris?
A 5-year-old boy has complained of difficulty breathing through his nose and a nasal tone to his voice. It is most likely due to the involvement of which of the following structures?
During surgical resection of the thyroid gland, the superior laryngeal artery must be ligated. During the procedure, the surgeon should take care to protect which of the following nerves?
An MRI of a patient shows an enlarged pituitary gland. The gland lies posterior and superior to which of the following paranasal air cells?

A 7-year-old boy presents to the ENT emergency with a complaint of nosebleed. His mother explains he was hit in the face with a football. The attending doctor examines and explains to the mother that the bleeding is from the anterior part of the nose and that it requires digital compression. Which vessel is not involved in the nosebleed?
Opening of the nasolacrimal duct lies immediately below which of the following structures?
Which of the following structures does not form the lateral wall of the nasal cavity?
In the acoustic reflex, the tensor tympani acts on which of the following structures?

A 36-year-old male presents to the ENT outpatient department with a complaint of muffled hearing, slight fever, and ear pain. After an evaluation, the ENT specialist explains that the patient is experiencing a middle ear infection which is causing the symptoms including conducting hearing loss. Conductive hearing loss does not involve which of the following structures?

answers.option: Hair cells of the inner ear

question: Which of the following is a typical respiratory epithelium?

The olfactory epithelium can be damaged by inhalation of toxic fumes, physical injury to the nose's interior, and possibly by using some nasal sprays. Which of the following consequences does it lead to?
Which of the following is the characteristic feature of the vermillion border of lips?

answers.option: It is devoid of glands in sub mucosa
Presence of hair follicles in dermis
The sub mucosa is composed of sweat glands and sebaceous glands
fibers of buccinator muscle is present in the muscular layer

question: Which of the following is the most abundant type of papillae found on the dorsum of the tongue?
Which of the following cranial nerves pass through the foramen magnum?
Which of the following nerves passes through the root of the neck?
Which of the following structures pierces the prevertebral fascia?

The mother of a 2-year-old boy consulted her pediatrician about an intermittent discharge of mucoid material from a small opening on the side of the boy's neck just behind the angle of the mandible, anterior to the sternocleidomastoid muscle. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following muscles, supplied by the cranial nerve VII, pierces the duct of the largest salivary gland?
Which of the following statements is inappropriate regarding platysma muscle?

answers.option: Lies in the superficial fascia of the neck
External jugular vein lies deep to it throughout its course
Forms the roof of the posterior triangle of the neck
Innervated by cervical branch of the facial nerve
Originates from the deep fascia covering deltoid and pectoralis major muscles

question: During embryonic life, which of the following parts of optic cups give rise to the layer of rods and cones photoreceptor cells?
Which of the following structures is not present in the infratemporal fossa?

A 25-year-old computer programmer complains of having difficulty seeing the whiteboard during meetings but has no problem reading his smartphone up close. What refractive error is he most likely experiencing?

A 45-year-old graphic designer has recently noticed that she needs to hold her design sketches further away to see them clearly. She also struggles to read small text unless it's well-lit. What condition is she likely developing?

A 60-year-old retired teacher finds it challenging to focus on his crossword puzzles even with his reading glasses. He also notices that his vision seems clouded, especially at night. What is the likely cause of his vision problems?
When rhodopsin absorbs light, it activates which of the following proteins?
In phototransduction, which ion channels are kept open in the dark, leading to a constant influx of sodium ions into the rod cell?
Which of the following enzymes is responsible for converting all-trans retinal back to 11-cis retinal in the visual cycle?
The process of accommodation is primarily controlled by which of the following parts of the nervous system?
What is the main action of the ciliary muscle during accommodation?
In the dark, the concentration of which substance increases in the cells to enhance sensitivity to light?
What is the term for the subjective sensation of spinning or whirling, often associated with inner ear disorder?
A 7-year-old child is having difficulty hearing high-frequency sounds during a hearing test. Which part of the ear does the doctor suspect is damaged?
An elderly person experiences a gradual decline in hearing ability, especially for high-frequency sounds. What is the most common cause of this type of hearing loss?
A recreational scuba diver experiences temporary hearing loss after a deep dive. What is the most likely explanation for this phenomenon?
Which of the following types of color vision deficiency might a person have due to the loss of blue cones?
Which of the following terms describes the distance between the center of the lens and the focal point when viewing the object at infinity?
A patient notices that he has lost his sense of taste after recovering from a severe cold. Which of the following conditions he might be experiencing?
A smoker notices a decreased ability to taste and smell. Which condition is commonly associated with reduced taste sensation due to damage to olfactory receptors?

Umami is one of the core's fifth tastes, a Japanese word meaning "essence of deliciousness," which designates a pleasant taste sensation that is qualitatively different from other tastes. This taste comes from food containing which of the following chemical compounds?

During a routine hearing examination of a 32-year-old woman, Rinne's test is conducted and it shows a negative result in the right ear. Subsequently, Weber's test is performed, and the sound is localized to the right side. Based on this scenario, what do these test results suggest?

answers.option: Nerve deafness on the right side
Conductive deafness on the left side
Both conductive and nerve deafness on the right side
Nerve deafness on the left side
Conductive deafness on the right side

question: The loudness of a sound wave as perceived by the human ear depends on which of the following pairs of wave properties?
Compared to the oval window, how much amplification is provided by the lever action of the auditory ossicles and the large size of the tympanic membrane?

Radioactive tracers are made up of carrier molecules that are bonded tightly to a radioactive atom. These carrier molecules vary greatly depending on the purpose of the scan. Which of the following is a commonly used method of administering the radioactive tracer to a patient?

Radiation is the emission or transmission of energy in the form of waves or particles through space or through a material medium. There are several forms of electromagnetic radiation, which differ only in frequency and wavelength. X-rays and gamma rays, are ionizing radiation and are more hazardous because they have which of the following properties?

A doctor was advising Pakistani hajj pilgrims about their upcoming travel. He also advised them about vaccines to be administered and precautions to be taken during their stay in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Which of the following vaccinations is important for the pilgrims?
Which of the following cranial nerve palsies causes ptosis?
Which of the following conditions are most infants born with?
Which of the following is the most common type of cancer in the head and neck region?

A 39-year-old male presented with nasal discharge and a nasopharyngeal mass. On histological examination, a tumor is composed of nests of atypical squamoid cells with pleomorphic hyperchromatic nuclei and abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm along with keratin pearls. Which of the following is strongly associated with this type of tumor?
Visual cycle refers to which of the following?

answers.option: Only day vision and color vision
Photodecomposition and regeneration of visual pigments
Cycle of night and color vision

question: In which of the following forms is dietary retinol transported in chylomicrons?
Which of the following vitamins is required for dim vision?

A 39-year-old man presents with a drooping left eyelid. He observes that lifting the eyelid to see results in double vision. He is also experiencing an immediate onset of severe headaches. On physical examination, his visual acuity is normal in both eyes. A left ptosis (drooping of eyes) is noted and the left pupil is dilated. The left eye is abducted in the primary position of the gaze. Testing eye movements reveals difficulty in adduction, elevation, and depression of the left eye. The remainder of the eye examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 39-year-old man presents with a drooping left eyelid. He observes that lifting the eyelid to see results in double vision. He is also experiencing an immediate onset of severe headaches. On physical examination, his visual acuity is normal in both eyes. A left ptosis (drooping of eyes) is noted and the left pupil is dilated. The left eye is abducted in the primary position of the gaze. Testing eye movements reveals difficulty in adduction, elevation, and depression of the left eye. The remainder of the eye examination is unremarkable. The aforementioned condition of the eyelid is due to the involvement/paralysis of which of the following muscles?

On physical examination, his visual acuity is normal in both eyes. A left ptosis (drooping of eyes) is noted and the left pupil is dilated. The left eye is abducted in the primary position of the gaze. Testing eye movements reveals difficulty in adduction, elevation, and depression of the left eye. The left eye is abducted in the primary position of the gaze. Testing eye movements reveals difficulty in adduction, elevation, and depression of the left eye. On physical examination, his visual acuity is normal in both eyes. A left ptosis (drooping of eyes) is noted and the left pupil is dilated.
